intro: Esenbeckia ovata, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Esenbeckia ovata is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in disturbed soils and open habitats.
